definition: having a supporting base, the act of assuming or maintaining an erect upright position
details:
adjective
- having a supporting base
- executed in or initiated from a standing position
- of fluids, not moving or flowing
= example: of fluids, not moving or flowing
- not created for a particular occasion
- of persons, on their feet
= example: of persons, on their feet
- permanent
= example: permanent
noun
- the act of assuming or maintaining an erect upright position
- an ordered listing of scores or results showing the relative positions of competitors (individuals or teams) in a sporting event
- social or financial or professional status or reputation
= example: social or financial or professional status or reputation
